intro: Corethrogyne leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf corethrogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
